Comment: So true. I’m 61 and have been a convert for 30 years now. It’s work and commitment to be a practicing Catholic and it never ends. Masses (and not just Sunday), practicing all sacraments, prayer life and on and on. It’s a complex yet very beautiful religion that simply asks of us to love one another and to serve the least amongst us. If you think on that last part, opportunity for that are endless and can be very tiring.  Joe Biden was a practicing Catholic.   The Pope telling off Vance and Trump in his Feb letter to US Bishops on immigration, and then recently to Vance’s face and then his follow-up worldwide message, is pretty grave. Especially a humble, people’s Pope such as Francis. This alone would scare the Hell out of me. Then he died. His last official words as Pope is admonishing the United States.
